summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 18679, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Twenty-third Avenue South, Twenty-fourth Avenue South, Twenty-fifth Avenue South and Twenty-sixth Avenue South, each from Yesler Way to Dearborn Street; Twenty-eight Avenue South and Twenty-ninth Avenue South, each from Jackson Street to Dearborn Street; and Jackson Street, from Twenty-third Avenue South to Thirty-first Avenue South all in the City of Seattle, by paving the same with asphalt and sandstone blocks, laid upon a proper concrete foundation, with concrete curbs and granite or armoured concrete corners, together with the necessary water mains of proper dimensions and material, in accordance with Resolution No. 1349 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle," approved June 24, 1908.
